alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 10 at 4:13PM AKST until December 11 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions and heavy snow. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches, with local amounts up to 12 inches possible. Highest snow amounts over interior Bristol Bay, including Koliganek and New Stuyahok. Northerly winds gusting 35 to 45 mph. * WHERE...Bristol Bay. * WHEN...Until 5 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Blowing snow and heavy snow will produce white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dillingham is located along the west of the heaviest snow, which will lead to snowfall amounts on the lower end of the range, with additional accumulations around 3 inches. However, blizzard conditions are likely to continue to be observed there, despite the lower snowfall rates. Snow spreads north to Iliamna this evening. Snowfall rates and winds will diminish Monday morning, allowing visibility to improve.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
